languages.text: "Этот танец зовется Танцем плененной раванеянки. Когда губернатор Ифрита Селимкан Ясный разбил мятеж раванеян, к нему привели дочь вождя бунтарей, прекрасноокую Наянну. Она танцевала для него, повествуя о борьбе своего гордого народа, а затем выхватила орудие из рук охранника и навела на Селимкана. Но искра вспыхнувшей между ними любви не позволила вспыхнуть искре фузелина в патроне, и оба они пережили тот день, а потом еще много дней, проведенных вместе".

"This dance is called the Dance of the Captive Ravaneyan Girl. When the governor of Efreet Selimkan the Bright crushed the Ravaneyan rebellion, the daughter of the rebel leader was brought to him — the beautiful Nayanna. She danced for him, telling him of the struggle of her proud people, and then snatched a weapon from a guard's hands and aimed it at Selimkan. But the spark of love that had kindled between them that day stopped the fyceline from igniting in the cartridge, and both Nayanna and Selimkan lived through that day, and then many more days, which they spent together."
languages.original_text: "Этот танец зовется Танцем плененной раванеянки. Когда губернатор Ифрита Селимкан Ясный разбил мятеж раванеян, к нему привели дочь вождя бунтарей, прекрасноокую Наянну. languages.text: “这支舞被称为‘被俘的拉瓦尼安少女之舞’。当时，艾弗里特的总督，光耀者塞利姆坎击溃了拉瓦尼安的叛军。而叛军首领的女儿，美丽的娜亚娜，也被带到了他面前。娜亚娜为塞利姆坎翩翩起舞，向他诉说着她骄傲的人民是如何抗争的。随后，她从一名卫兵手中抢过了武器，瞄准了塞利姆坎。然而，他们之间却燃起了爱的火花，弹匣里的那枚子弹始终没有从枪口射出来。塞利姆坎和娜亚娜都安然度过了那一天。而在接下来许多、许多天里，两人也都共同度过，形影不离。”
languages.original_text: "This dance is called the Dance of the Captive Ravaneyan Girl. When the governor of Efreet Selimkan the Bright crushed the Ravaneyan rebellion, the daughter of the rebel leader was brought to him — the beautiful Nayanna. She danced for him, telling him of the struggle of her proud people, and then snatched a weapon from a guard's hands and aimed it at Selimkan. But the spark of love that had kindled between them that day stopped the fyceline from igniting in the cartridge, and both Nayanna and Selimkan lived through that day, and then many more days, which they spent together."

traits.locale_text: “这支舞被称为‘被俘的拉瓦尼安少女之舞’。当时，艾弗里特的总督，光耀者塞利姆坎击溃了拉瓦尼安的叛军。而叛军首领的女儿，美丽的娜亚娜，也被带到了他面前。娜亚娜为塞利姆坎翩翩起舞，向他诉说着她骄傲的人民是如何抗争的。随后，她从一名卫兵手中抢过了武器，瞄准了塞利姆坎。然而，他们之间却燃起了爱的火花，弹匣里的那枚子弹始终没有从枪口射出来。塞利姆坎和娜亚娜都安然度过了那一天。而在接下来许多、许多天里，两人也都共同度过，形影不离。”

languages.text: 「このダンスは『捕らわれのラバニャン少女の踊り』と呼ばれているんだ。イフリート総督である眩きセリムカンがラバニヤンの反乱を鎮圧したとき、反乱軍リーダーの娘である美しきナヤンナが彼のもとに連れてこられた。彼女は彼のために踊り、誇り高き民の闘いを語り、衛兵の手から武器を奪ってセリムカンに向けた。しかし、その日、二人の間に燃え上がった愛の火花が、ファイセリン燃料が点火するのを止め、そうしてナヤンナとセリムカンはその日を生き延びた。それ以降も、数多の歳月を共に過ごしたとさ」
languages.original_text: "This dance is called the Dance of the Captive Ravaneyan Girl. When the governor of Efreet Selimkan the Bright crushed the Ravaneyan rebellion, the daughter of the rebel leader was brought to him — the beautiful Nayanna. She danced for him, telling him of the struggle of her proud people, and then snatched a weapon from a guard's hands and aimed it at Selimkan. But the spark of love that had kindled between them that day stopped the fyceline from igniting in the cartridge, and both Nayanna and Selimkan lived through that day, and then many more days, which they spent together."

traits.locale_text: 「このダンスは『捕らわれのラバニャン少女の踊り』と呼ばれているんだ。イフリート総督である眩きセリムカンがラバニヤンの反乱を鎮圧したとき、反乱軍リーダーの娘である美しきナヤンナが彼のもとに連れてこられた。彼女は彼のために踊り、誇り高き民の闘いを語り、衛兵の手から武器を奪ってセリムカンに向けた。しかし、その日、二人の間に燃え上がった愛の火花が、ファイセリン燃料が点火するのを止め、そうしてナヤンナとセリムカンはその日を生き延びた。それ以降も、数多の歳月を共に過ごしたとさ」

languages.text: «Este baile es el Baile de la Cautiva Ravaneyana. Cuando el gobernador de Efreet, Selimkan el Brillante, aplastó la rebelión ravaneyana, hizo que le trajeran a la hija del líder rebelde, la hermosa Nayanna. Ella bailó para él, contándole la lucha de su orgulloso pueblo. Alguien arrebató un arma a un guardia y la apuntó contra Selimkan, pero la chispa de amor que había brotado entre ambos evitó que la fycelina del cartucho estallara y tanto Nayanna como Selimkan sobrevivieron a ese día y a muchos otros, pasándolos juntos felizmente».
languages.original_text: "This dance is called the Dance of the Captive Ravaneyan Girl. When the governor of Efreet Selimkan the Bright crushed the Ravaneyan rebellion, the daughter of the rebel leader was brought to him — the beautiful Nayanna. She danced for him, telling him of the struggle of her proud people, and then snatched a weapon from a guard's hands and aimed it at Selimkan. But the spark of love that had kindled between them that day stopped the fyceline from igniting in the cartridge, and both Nayanna and Selimkan lived through that day, and then many more days, which they spent together."

traits.locale_text: «Este baile es el Baile de la Cautiva Ravaneyana. Cuando el gobernador de Efreet, Selimkan el Brillante, aplastó la rebelión ravaneyana, hizo que le trajeran a la hija del líder rebelde, la hermosa Nayanna. Ella bailó para él, contándole la lucha de su orgulloso pueblo. Alguien arrebató un arma a un guardia y la apuntó contra Selimkan, pero la chispa de amor que había brotado entre ambos evitó que la fycelina del cartucho estallara y tanto Nayanna como Selimkan sobrevivieron a ese día y a muchos otros, pasándolos juntos felizmente».

languages.text: « On appelle ça la "danse de la jeune Ravaneyane prisonnière". Lorsque le gouverneur d'Éfrit, Selimkan l'Éclairé, écrasa la révolte des Ravaneyans, la fille du chef des rebelles, la belle Nayanna, fut conduite devant lui. Elle dansa pour lui, lui contant les épreuves traversées par son noble peuple, avant d'arracher l'arme des mains d'un garde et de la braquer sur Selimkan. Par un coup du sort, l'amour qui venait de naître entre eux à cet instant précis empêcha la fyceline de mettre le feu à la cartouche ; Nayanna et Selimkan survécurent donc à cette journée et en connurent bien d'autres, qu'ils passèrent toutes ensemble. »
languages.original_text: "This dance is called the Dance of the Captive Ravaneyan Girl. When the governor of Efreet Selimkan the Bright crushed the Ravaneyan rebellion, the daughter of the rebel leader was brought to him — the beautiful Nayanna. She danced for him, telling him of the struggle of her proud people, and then snatched a weapon from a guard's hands and aimed it at Selimkan. But the spark of love that had kindled between them that day stopped the fyceline from igniting in the cartridge, and both Nayanna and Selimkan lived through that day, and then many more days, which they spent together."

traits.locale_text: « On appelle ça la "danse de la jeune Ravaneyane prisonnière". Lorsque le gouverneur d'Éfrit, Selimkan l'Éclairé, écrasa la révolte des Ravaneyans, la fille du chef des rebelles, la belle Nayanna, fut conduite devant lui. Elle dansa pour lui, lui contant les épreuves traversées par son noble peuple, avant d'arracher l'arme des mains d'un garde et de la braquer sur Selimkan. Par un coup du sort, l'amour qui venait de naître entre eux à cet instant précis empêcha la fyceline de mettre le feu à la cartouche ; Nayanna et Selimkan survécurent donc à cette journée et en connurent bien d'autres, qu'ils passèrent toutes ensemble. »

languages.text: "Der Name dieses Tanzes ist 'Tanz des gefangenen ravanischen Mädchens'. Als der Gouverneur von Efreet Selimkan der Gescheite den Aufstand der Ravanier niederschlug, wurde ihm die Tochter des Rebellenanführers gebracht – die schöne Nayanna. Sie tanzte für ihn und erzählte ihm vom Kampf ihres stolzen Volkes. Dann entriss sie einer Wache eine Waffe und richtete sie auf Selimkan. Aber an diesem Tage entfachte der Funke ihrer Liebe und verhinderte, dass sich das Fycelin in der Patrone entzündete. So überlebten Nayanna und Selimkan und verbrachten noch viele gemeinsame Tage zusammen."
languages.original_text: "This dance is called the Dance of the Captive Ravaneyan Girl. When the governor of Efreet Selimkan the Bright crushed the Ravaneyan rebellion, the daughter of the rebel leader was brought to him — the beautiful Nayanna. She danced for him, telling him of the struggle of her proud people, and then snatched a weapon from a guard's hands and aimed it at Selimkan. But the spark of love that had kindled between them that day stopped the fyceline from igniting in the cartridge, and both Nayanna and Selimkan lived through that day, and then many more days, which they spent together."

Als der Gouverneur von Efreet Selimkan der Gescheite den Aufstand der Ravanier niederschlug, wurde ihm die Tochter des Rebellenanführers gebracht – die schöne Nayanna. Sie tanzte für ihn und erzählte ihm vom Kampf ihres stolzen Volkes. Dann entriss sie einer Wache eine Waffe und richtete sie auf Selimkan. languages.text: "Bu dansın adı, Ravaneyalı Tutsak Kızın Dansı. İfrit valisi Parıldayan Selimkan'ın Ravaneya isyanını bastırması sonrasında isyancı lideri, güzeller güzeli Nayanna onun karşısına getirilmiş. Selimkan için dans etmiş, ona onurlu halkının yaşadığı sıkıntılardan bahsetmiş, ardından da muhafızın birinin elindeki silahı kapıp onu hedef almış. Ancak o gün ikisinin arasında aşk kıvılcımları ateşlenmiş ve fiselinin kartuşu ateşlemesini durdurmuş. Nayanna ve Selimkan, o gün hayatta kalmış ve uzun ömürlerinin geri kalanını birlikte geçirmişler."
languages.original_text: "This dance is called the Dance of the Captive Ravaneyan Girl. When the governor of Efreet Selimkan the Bright crushed the Ravaneyan rebellion, the daughter of the rebel leader was brought to him — the beautiful Nayanna. She danced for him, telling him of the struggle of her proud people, and then snatched a weapon from a guard's hands and aimed it at Selimkan. But the spark of love that had kindled between them that day stopped the fyceline from igniting in the cartridge, and both Nayanna and Selimkan lived through that day, and then many more days, which they spent together."

traits.locale_text: "Bu dansın adı Ravaneyalı Tutsak Kızın Dansı. İfrit valisi Parıldayan Selimkan, Ravaneya isyanını bastırdıktan sonra isyancı lideri, güzeller güzeli Nayanna onun karşısına getirilmiş. Selimkan için dans etmiş, ona onurlu halkının yaşadığı sıkıntılardan bahsetmiş, ardından da muhafızın birinin elindeki silahı kapıp onu hedef almış. Ancak o gün ikisinin arasında aşk kıvılcımları ateşlenmiş ve fiselinin kartuşu ateşlemesini durdurmuş. Nayanna ve Selimkan o gün hayatta kalmış ve uzun ömürlerinin geri kalanını birlikte geçirmişler."
